thread.title: Woman accidentally shot by police to get $20K for children - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: Woman accidentally shot by police to get $20K for children - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Woman accidentally shot by police to get $20K for children - Massachusetts news
text:
AGAWAM, Mass. (AP) — A mother has been awarded $20,000 on behalf of two of her children after she was accidentally shot in the face by a Massachusetts police officer while pregnant.
Britteney Miles, of Agawam, filed the lawsuit in federal court in April. WWLP-TV reports (http://bit.ly/1G8R7g0 ) a federal judge approved a settlement Thursday. The settlement is for emotional distress for the children and the money will go into investment accounts.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Miles was shot in the face and chin on May 5, 2012 when then-Agawam police officer Danielle Petrangelo accidentally fired her weapon through the door. Police were responding to Miles’ apartment building for a possible break-in.
Petrangelo was cleared of any criminal wrongdoing and left the department.
Miles is still suing the town for $1.5 million in federal court.
___
Information from: WWLP-TV, http://www.wwlp.com
